location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file. A circled serial number in red crayon refers to an entry in the notes at the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at 1 on the front cover and terminates at 15 on the last folio before the back cover. The numbers are written in pencil and appear in the top right hand corner of the recto page of each folio. Foliation anomaly: ff. 1, 1 A.

mods.abstract: The file consists of:papers concerning the arrangements for a wedding at Bahrain between two British subjects, including correspondence between Lieutenant-Colonel Percy George Loch, Political Agent, Bahrain and Captain Everard Huddleston Gastrell, Secretary to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, October - November 1933;correspondence concerning the powers of the Political Agent Bahrain to perform marriages in Bahrain under the provisions of the Indian Christian Marriage Act of 1872, March - April 1936.
